Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • Console
  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    Console is a controller of the Game

    Console is characterized by :

    • A number of test
    • A mode of selection
    • A size of combination
    • A choice to determine in run()
    • A mode of development to display or not the combination of IA
    • A boolean victory to determine end of the game
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Geoffrey

      Constructors

      Console​(int nbCombination, boolean modeDev, int nbTest)
      Builder Console.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void challenger​(Entity player1, Entity player2, int index)
      Challenger is a function to launch defense of player2 then launch attack of player 1 this function compares the 2 combination Display a list of signs if the result is equal to ==== then victory is update to true
      char comparator​(int num1, int num2)
      comparator is a simple function to compare num1 with num2
      void defender​(Entity player1, Entity player2, int index)
      Defender is a function to launch defense of player1 then launch attack of player 2 display the combination of attack this function compares the 2 combination and launch an update of matrix maxMin of player2 Display a list of signs if the result is equal to ==== then victory is update to true
      void duel​(Entity player1, Entity player2, Entity player3, Entity player4, int index)
      duel launches a function challenger with player 1 and 2 then if there is no winner launches defender
      void game()
      game checked if user select restart with the same mode else asks the type of game initializes victory to false and loop the game selected by the number of trials if the solution is not found, solution is display
      void run()
      run the game, and after request a choice to the user and loop as long as not quit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Console

        public Console​(int nbCombination,
               boolean modeDev,
               int nbTest)
        Builder Console.

        when building a Console object, we define the size of combination the number of test and if the mode of development is activate

        Parameters:
        nbCombination - the size of combination.
        modeDev - the mode of development.
        nbTest - the number of test
        See Also:
        nbCombination, modeDev, nbTest

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        run the game, and after request a choice to the user and loop as long as not quit
        See Also:
        choice, game()

      • game

        public void game()
        game checked if user select restart with the same mode else asks the type of game initializes victory to false and loop the game selected by the number of trials if the solution is not found, solution is display
        See Also:
        choice, modeSelect, nbCombination, victory, nbTest, challenger(Entity, Entity, int), defender(Entity, Entity, int), duel(Entity, Entity, Entity, Entity, int)

      • challenger

        public void challenger​(Entity player1,
                       Entity player2,
                       int index)
        Challenger is a function to launch defense of player2 then launch attack of player 1 this function compares the 2 combination Display a list of signs if the result is equal to ==== then victory is update to true
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is the attacker (often it's the player IRL)
        player2 - player2 is the defense (often it's the IA)
        index - index represent the number of iteration not to raise twice the defense
        See Also:
        modeDev, nbCombination, victory, comparator(int, int), Entity.combination

      • defender

        public void defender​(Entity player1,
                     Entity player2,
                     int index)
        Defender is a function to launch defense of player1 then launch attack of player 2 display the combination of attack this function compares the 2 combination and launch an update of matrix maxMin of player2 Display a list of signs if the result is equal to ==== then victory is update to true
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is the defense (often it's the player IRL)
        player2 - player2 is the attacker (often it's the IA)
        index - index represent the number of iteration not to raise twice the defense
        See Also:
        nbCombination, comparator(int, int), victory, IA.update(char, int), Entity.combination

      • duel

        public void duel​(Entity player1,
                 Entity player2,
                 Entity player3,
                 Entity player4,
                 int index)
        duel launches a function challenger with player 1 and 2 then if there is no winner launches defender
        Parameters:
        player1 - player1 is the attacker to challenger (often it's the player IRL)
        player2 - player2 is the defense to challenger (often it's the IA)
        player3 - player2 is the defense to defender (often it's the player IRL)
        player4 - player4 is the attacker to defender (often it's the IA)
        index - index represent the number of iteration not to raise twice the defense
        See Also:
        victory, challenger(Entity, Entity, int), defender(Entity, Entity, int)

      • comparator

        public char comparator​(int num1,
                       int num2)
        comparator is a simple function to compare num1 with num2
        Parameters:
        num1 - num1 is a number to be compared
        num2 - num2 is a number reference
        Returns:
        a char with a sign (+ or - or =)
